title: Find UD/UCMDB log files
content:
Once NFS Persistent volumes (PVs) are created successfully for UD/UCMDB, you can access UD/UCMDB log files through NFS ucmdb-log-volume directories.

Component Example NFS volume name Description Example Directory path
UCMDB Server ucmdb-log-volume Stores logs generated by UCMDB Server

<NFS_Logs_Volume_Directory>/ucmdb/server/<itom-ucmdb Pod Name>
UCMDB Browser ucmdb-log-volume Stores logs generated by UCMDB Browser <NFS_Logs_Volume_Directory>/ucmdb/browser/
UCMDB Probe ucmdb-log-volume Stores logs generated by UCMDB Probe <NFS_Logs_Volume_Directory>/ucmdb/probe
Gateway ucmdb-log-volume Stores logs generated by UCMDB Gateway <NFS_Logs_Volume_Directory>/cms-gateway
IDM ucmdb-log-volume Stores logs generated by IDM <NFS_Logs_Volume_Directory>/cdf-deployments/<namespace>__<pod name>__<container_name>__<host>
AutoPass ucmdb-log-volume Stores logs generated by AutoPass <NFS_Logs_Volume_Directory>/apls

Where,

  • <NFS_Logs_Volume_Directory> represents the NFS logs volumn directory, for example, /var/vols/itom/ucmdb/log_volume
  • <itom-ucmdb Pod Name> / <itom-cms-gateway Pod Name> can be retrieved by running the following command:
    kubectl get pod -n <UD/UCMDB namespace>
